alert.note: Alert for Elbert (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 12 at 7:23AM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 AM MDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Colorado, including the following county, Elbert. * WHEN...Until 930 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 723 AM MDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 0.2 and 0.8 inches of rain have fallen, in addition to the 1 to 3 inches of rain that already fell in the past 24 hours. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Central Elbert County
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause minor flooding of small creeks and streams, country roads, farmland along creeks, and other low lying areas.
